Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.Client

Class CLI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.CLI
All Implemented Interfaces:
UI
public class CLI
extends java.lang.Object
implements UI
Class for the Command Line Interface. It implements the methods of the UI. The CLI is the default option for the Main.

  • Constructor Details

    • CLI

      public CLI​(ClientView clientView)
      Constructor passing the ClientView in order to communicate to the server. It also initializes a scanner to retrieve user's input data and the board's representation.
      Parameters:
      clientView -

  • Method Details

    • setClientView

      public void setClientView​(ClientView clientView)

    • start

      public void start()
      Print's Santorini as a welcome title and opens the client socket.
      Specified by:
      start in interface UI

    • login

      public void login()
      Attempts to log a player to a lobby with the username typed by the player (more than 3 char). It calls ClientView.loginQuestion(String)
      Specified by:
      login in interface UI

    • failedLogin

      public void failedLogin​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> users)
      Called when the server informs the client that their attempt to log was refused due to the unavailability of the picked username. It calls ClientView.loginQuestion(String) again
      Specified by:
      failedLogin in interface UI
      Parameters:
      users - List of already logged players

    • selectPlayableDivinities

      public void selectPlayableDivinities​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> divinitiesNames, java.util.List<java.lang.String> divinitiesDescriptions, int playersNumber, java.util.List<java.lang.String> players)
      Called if the CLI is the one of the last player. It displays the list of divinities with their description at the side of an increasing number, it reads the player's input (in range integer) to add the relative divinity to the list of the divinities, and after repeating the process for a time equals to the number of players, it reads the number of the starting player selected (the list of players is printed) and sends everything to the server thanks to ClientView.playableDivinitiesSelection(List, String).
      Specified by:
      selectPlayableDivinities in interface UI
      Parameters:
      divinitiesNames - List of all divinities
      divinitiesDescriptions - List of their effects
      playersNumber - number of players in game
      players - Names of the players

    • selectDivinity

      public void selectDivinity​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> divinitiesNames)
      Called when a player has to select their divinity. The list of divinities they can choose from is printed, the user's input is read and if it is correct the choice is sent through the invocation of ClientView.divinitySelection(String)
      Specified by:
      selectDivinity in interface UI
      Parameters:
      divinitiesNames - names of the selectable divinities

    • placeWorkers

      public void placeWorkers()
      It prints a dummy board (similar to a chess board) whose model will be used for the rest of the game. The player will have to choose the coordinates for the two worker. If the coordinates are valid, they will be sent to the server thanks to ClientView.workerPlacement(int, int, int, int)
      Specified by:
      placeWorkers in interface UI

    • textMessage

      public void textMessage​(java.lang.String msg)
      Displays the text message received from the server
      Specified by:
      textMessage in interface UI
      Parameters:
      msg - generic message

    • startTurn

      public void startTurn()
      Informs the client that their turn has started displaying a message, updating the board and starting the selection of the worker phase.
      Specified by:
      startTurn in interface UI

    • selectWorker

      public void selectWorker()
      Called when the client needs to choose the worker that will perform the actions until the end of the turn. The player's workers are shown and one has to be chosen. Once a valid choice is read the event is sent to the server through ClientView.selectWorkerQuestion(int, int)
      Specified by:
      selectWorker in interface UI

    • performAction

      public void performAction​(java.util.Map<Action,​java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>>> possibleActions)
      Methods that prints the user's available actions and uses a scanner to get the input. Eventually it sends an event with ClientView.actionQuestion(Action, int, int)
      Specified by:
      performAction in interface UI
      Parameters:
      possibleActions - Map of Action and list of coordinates

    • invalidMove

      public void invalidMove​(java.util.Map<Action,​java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>>> possibleActions, int wrongX, int wrongY, int startX, int startY)
      Method invoked when the client attempted a bad move. It performs a basic control on the board to check if the move violated one of the basic rules of Santorini, otherwise, if the bad move was caused by a divinity's effect it displays YOU CAN'T MOVE HERE. Then the user needs to choose again performAction(Map)
      Specified by:
      invalidMove in interface UI
      Parameters:
      possibleActions - list of possible actions
      wrongX - wrong x coordinate
      wrongY - wrong y coordinate
      startX -
      startY -

    • invalidBuild

      public void invalidBuild​(java.util.Map<Action,​java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>>> possibleActions, int wrongX, int wrongY, int actualX, int actualY)
      Method invoked when the client attempted a bad build. It performs a basic control on the board to check if the build violated one of the basic rules of Santorini, otherwise, if the bad build was caused by a divinity's effect it displays YOU CAN'T BUILD HERE. Then the user needs to choose again performAction(Map)
      Specified by:
      invalidBuild in interface UI
      Parameters:
      possibleActions - list of possible actions
      wrongX - wrong x coordinate
      wrongY - wrong y coordinate
      actualX -
      actualY -

    • invalidWorkerPlacement

      public void invalidWorkerPlacement()
      Informs the client that their workers' placement was incorrect. It causes the user to choose again placeWorkers()
      Specified by:
      invalidWorkerPlacement in interface UI

    • invalidWorkerSelection

      public void invalidWorkerSelection​(int wrongX, int wrongY)
      Informs the client that their worker's selection is wrong; it shows a pertinent message and it calls selectWorker()
      Specified by:
      invalidWorkerSelection in interface UI
      Parameters:
      wrongX - wrong x position
      wrongY - wrong y position

    • moveUpdate

      public void moveUpdate​(java.lang.String player, int xFrom, int yFrom, int xTo, int yTo)
      Called when a player moves a worker. It consequently updates the board.
      Specified by:
      moveUpdate in interface UI
      Parameters:
      player - name of the player moving
      xFrom - beginning worker's position
      yFrom - beginning worker's position
      xTo - destination worker's position
      yTo - destination worker's position

    • buildUpdate

      public void buildUpdate​(java.lang.String player, int x, int y)
      Called when a player builds. It consequently updates the board.
      Specified by:
      buildUpdate in interface UI
      Parameters:
      player - name of the building player
      x - coordinate of the tile built
      y - coordinate of the tile built

    • workerPlacementUpdate

      public void workerPlacementUpdate​(java.lang.String player, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Called when a player places their workers; it updates the board.
      Specified by:
      workerPlacementUpdate in interface UI
      Parameters:
      player - name of the player to retrieve their color
      x1 - first worker's coordinate
      y1 - first worker's coordinate
      x2 - second worker's coordinate
      y2 - second worker's coordinate

    • serverDisconnection

      public void serverDisconnection()
      Called when the server cannot be reaches. It aborts the process.
      Specified by:
      serverDisconnection in interface UI

    • updateBoard

      public void updateBoard()
      Prints the board writing the coordinates (numbers on top, letters at the side) and reads the BoardRepresentation to correctly place the workers, the buildings and the domes.

    • printPlayersInGame

      public void printPlayersInGame()
      Prints the list of players alongside with their divinity in a different colors each.
